title: Human_HD_part1
description:
Human is a 2015 documentary by environmentalist Yann Arthus-Bertrand. The film is almost entirely composed of exclusive aerial footage and first-person stories told into the camera. It was the first movie to premiere in the General Assembly Hall of the United Nations, to an audience of 1,000 viewers, including U.N. Secretary General Ban Ki-moon

What makes us human? Does the fact of loving, is it the fact to fight? The laughing? Crying? Our curiosity? Our journey of discovery?

 With a passionate team of translators, journalists and cameramen, Yann captured deep emotions and issues that unite us all: the struggle against poverty, war, homophobia and the future of our planet, mixed with moments love and happiness.

The VOL.1 addresses themes of love, women, work and poverty.
